frameDefinitions: An Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
A Communicator (whose Location may be indicated) directs a Communication to an Addressee at a particular Address.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
An event or state (here termed an Eventuality) or time-Period is described in terms of the Degree to which its duration diverges from a standard.
frameExamples: Pilot Mountain in NC is very <t>prominent</t>.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
Disgruntled voters <t>phoned</t> Congressman Neil at his Washington residence with complaints about the recent increases in corporate welfare.
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
After a <t>lengthy</t> discussion with the Foreign Minister, Mr. Qian Qichen, they met the Prime Minister.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the saliency <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion, namely perceptual salience.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular salience.
This role refers to the location where the <fen>Entity</fen> has a prominence of some <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a message to another person.
The person that receives the message from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
This role is used for a (metaphorical) place in a system of communication where <fen>Communicator</fen>s and <fen>Addressee</fen>s can access the system.

The information that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wishes to impart to the <fen>Addressee</fen>, often to get a particular response. In this frame the <fen>Communication</fen> is not necessarily received by the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
This is the subject matter to which the message pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.

A situation, action or event whose duration is being described.  The Eventuality occurs as the External Argument if the adjective is used predicatively, or as the modified noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Eventuality'>The lecture</fex> was <t>short</t>. We had a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Eventuality'>conversation</fex>.

Sometimes these adjectives describe simply a period of time, rather than an event or state.  The Period almost invariably occurs as the modified noun with an attributive adjective: We waited for only a <t>short</t> <fex name='Period'>time</fex>. Use of the drug over a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Period'>period</fex> can cause memory loss.
listRoleExamples: If you are asked to search for the plus sign with red-vertical and green-horizontal elements, <fex>all the red and green plus signs</fex> may seem to become salient.
The diagram, (a frequency distribution chart) shows a <fex>prominently</fex> conspicuous region of stars that extend from the extremely bright and hot stars to the faint and cool variety.
The affection for American culture seemed more prominent <fex>last year</fex>.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
The company must be able to call <fex> potential customers</fex>.
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
